key_events.description: Physical vacancy around 4% in December 2025. October 2025 vacancy (% ABL) average was 4.2%. Net delinquency was 2.2% in October 2025.

Next dividend per share will be R$0.92 with an ex date of February 19, 2026, and a payment date of February 25, 2026. Maintained dividend of R$0.92 for 21 consecutive months. December 2025 dividend is R$0.92 per share.
XP Malls is considering raising R$ 400 million through a share issuance.

risk_factors: Share issuance may dilute existing shareholders.

investment_thesis.bull_case: Consistent dividend payments of R$0.92 per share for 21 months provide stable income.
investment_thesis.bear_case: Potential share issuance of R$400 million could dilute shareholder value. Vacancy rates and delinquency need to be monitored.

summary_markdown: XPML11's physical vacancy was around 4% in December 2025. The average vacancy (% ABL) was 4.2% in October 2025, with a net delinquency of 2.2%. The next dividend will be R$0.92 per share (ex date: February 19, 2026; payment date: February 25, 2026). The fund has maintained a dividend of R$0.92 for 21 consecutive months. XP Malls is considering a R$ 400 million share issuance.
